extendedIngredients.name: green cabbage
extendedIngredients.originalString: Thinly sliced green cabbage, radish, or chopped onion

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 to 2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste (see Note)

extendedIngredients.name: oregano
extendedIngredients.originalString: Dried oregano, preferably Mexican, to sprinkle on top

extendedIngredients.name: pork stock
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 cups chicken broth or pork stock

extendedIngredients.name: white onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 white onion, halved through the core and peeled

recipes.title: Dinner Tonight: Red Posole Stew with Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Cabernet Sauvignon, Chablis, and Malbec are my top picks for Stew. Full-bodied red wines like malbec and cabernet sauvignon are the perfect accompaniment for beef stew. Fish stew probably calls for a white wine, such as chablis. One wine you could try is Chimney Rock Stags Leap District Cabernet Sauvignon ( half-bottle). It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 40 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chimney Rock Stags Leap District Cabernet Sauvignon ( half-bottle)
productMatches.description: Inky purple red. Aromas of black currant, licorice, along with hints of clove and vanilla. This wine is silky smooth, with a deeply structured backbone of fine grain tannins and a long bright finish. Blend: 87% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Franc

recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            In a medium stockpot, combine the chicken, hominy, broth, and water. Bring to a boil and simmer gently until the chicken is just cooked through. Remove the chicken pieces to cool on a plate, then separate the meat from the bones, skin, and cartilage. Roughly chop the meat and discard the rest. Keep the chicken moist in a small bowl with some of the hot broth poured over it.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            In the meantime, heat a griddle or cast-iron pan with no oil over medium-low heat and add the dried chiles, garlic clove, and onion. Cook, turning occassionally, until soft and browned. Take care not to burn the chile. Transfer to a bowl and cover with the boiling water to reconstitute the chiles, about 10 minutes.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Transfer the chile mixture and soaking water to a blender, puree, and add to the soup (do this little-by-little to control the spiciness). Simmer everything together for at least 20 minutes. When the flavor is developed, add the chicken meat to the soup and simmer for an additional couple minutes.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Serve with the cabbage, radish, or onion. Offer the oregano to sprinkle on top, and serve with lime wedges and tortillas.

steps.step: In a medium stockpot, combine the chicken, hominy, broth, and water. Bring to a boil and simmer gently until the chicken is just cooked through.

Remove the chicken pieces to cool on a plate, then separate the meat from the bones, skin, and cartilage. Roughly chop the meat and discard the rest. Keep the chicken moist in a small bowl with some of the hot broth poured over it.

In the meantime, heat a griddle or cast-iron pan with no oil over medium-low heat and add the dried chiles, garlic clove, and onion. Cook, turning occassionally, until soft and browned. Take care not to burn the chile.
Transfer to a bowl and cover with the boiling water to reconstitute the chiles, about 10 minutes.

Transfer the chile mixture and soaking water to a blender, puree, and add to the soup (do this little-by-little to control the spiciness). Simmer everything together for at least 20 minutes. When the flavor is developed, add the chicken meat to the soup and simmer for an additional couple minutes.
Serve with the cabbage, radish, or onion. Offer the oregano to sprinkle on top, and serve with lime wedges and tortillas.
